div.p: THE RULES AND DIRECTIONS of the LORDS and COMMONS Aſſembled in PARLIAMENT: Concerning the Examination of all ſuch as ſhall be admitted to the Sacrament of the LORDS SUPPER, Within the Kingdome of England, and Dominion of Wales: Contained In an Ordinance of the twentieth of October, 1645. with Queſtions and Anſwers concerning the ſame.
Printed at London for M. Wright, at the Kings Head in the Old Bayley. 1659.

div.head: Rules and Directions concerning ſuſpenſion from the Sacrament of the Lords Supper, in caſe of Ignorance.

list.item:
1. ALl ſuch perſons who ſhall bee admitted to the Sacrament of the Lords Supper, ought to know that there is a God, that there is but one ever living and true God, maker of Heaven and Earth, and Governour of all things; That this onely true God, is the God whom we worſhip; that this God is but one, yet three diſtinct Perſons, the
Father, Son, and holy Ghoſt, all equall God.

2. That God created man ofter his owne Image, in knowledge, righteouſneſs, and true holineſs; That by one man ūn entied into the world, and death by ſin, and ſo death paſſed upon all men, for that all have ſinned; That thereby they are all dead in treſpaſſes and ſins, and are by nature the Children of wrath, and ſo lyable to eternall death, the wages of every ſin.

3. That there is but one Mediator betweene God and man, the man Chriſt Ieſus, who is alſo overall, God bleſſed for ever, neither is there ſalvation in any other; That he was conceived by the holy Ghoſt, and born of the Virgin Mary; that he dyed upon the croſſe to ſave his people from their ſins; That he role againe the third day from the dead, aſcended
into Heaven, ſits at the right hand of God, and makes continuall interceſſion for us, of whoſe fulneſs we receive all grace neceſſary to ſalvation.
4. That Chriſt and his benefits are applied onely by faith; That faith is the gift of God, and that we have it not of our ſelves, but it is wrought in us by the Word and Spirit of God.

div.p: That faith is that grace, whereby we believe and truſt in Chriſt for remiſſion of ſins, and life everlaſting according to the promiſe of the Goſpell, that whoſoever believes not on the Son of God ſhall not ſee life, but ſhall periſh eternally.
That they who truly repent of their ſins, do ſee them, forrow for them, and turn from them to the Lord, and that except men repent they ſhall ſurely periſh.

That a godly life is conſcionably
ordered according to the Word of God, in Holineſſe and Righteouſneſſe, without which no man ſhall ſee God.

That the Sacraments are Seals of the Covenant of Grace in the Blood of Chriſt: That the Sacraments of the new Teſtament, are Baptiſme and the Lords Supper; that the outward Elements in the Lords Supper are Bread & Wine, and doe ſignifie the Body and Blood of Chriſt Crucified, which the worthy Receiver by faith doth partake of in this Sacrament, which Chriſt hath like wiſe ordained for the remembrance of this death; that whoſoever eats and drinkes unworthily, is guilty of the Body and Blood of the Lord; and therefore that every one is to examine himſelfe, left he eat and drink iudgement to himſelfe, not diſcerning the Lords Body.
That the ſoules of the faithfull after death, do immediately live with Chriſt in bleſſedneſſe; and that the ſouls of the wicked, doe immediately goe into Hell torments.

That there ſhall be a Reſurrection of the Bodies, both of the juſt and unjuſt at the laſt Day, at which time all ſhall appeare before the Iudgement Seat of Chriſt, to receive according to what they have done in the body, whether it be good or evill: And that the righteous ſhall goe into life eternall, and the wicked into everlaſting puniſhment.

And it is further ordained by the Lords and Commons, that thoſe who have a competent meaſure of underſtanding concerning the matters contained in theſe Articles ſhall not bee kept backe from the Sacrament
of the Lords Supper for Ignorance. And that the Examination and iudgment of ſuch perſons as ſhall for their ignorance of the aforeſaid points of Religion not be admited to the Sacrament of the Lods Supper, is to be in the power of the Elderſhip of every congregation.

div.head: SHORT Queſtions and Anſwers.

p.label: Q
p.hi: WHat is God?

div.p: A. A moſt holy Spirit, Infinite in all perfections, Ioh. 4.24. 1 Tim. 6.16.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How many Gods are there?

div.p: A. One onely, 1 Cor. 8.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Into how many Perſons is this one God diſtinguiſhed?

div.p: A. Into three, The Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghoſt, Mat. 28.19. 1 Joh. 5.7.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what eſtate was man made by God at firſt?

div.p: A. In a very happy eſtate, being made after the Image of God, Gen. 1.27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what reſpect is man ſaid to be made after the Image of God?

div.p: A. In that he was indued with perfect knowledge, and with true holineſſe and righteouſneſſe, Col. 3.10. Eph. 4.24.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Did man alwaies continue in that happy eſtate wherein he was at firſt made?

div.p: A. No, he became miſerable by ſinne, Gen. 3.17.
Q. What was the ſin which Adam did commit?
A. Diſobedience againſt God, in eating the forbidden fruit, Gen. 3.3, 6.
Q. Did all Man-kind ſin in Adam?
A. Yes: Adam was a publick perſon, and we were all in his loines, Rom. 5.19.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is ſin in generall?

div.p: A. A tranſgreſſion of Gods Commandments, 1 John 3.4.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What be the kinds of ſin:

list.item: 1. Originall, which is the corruption of nature, wherein we are conceived and born, Gal. 5.19.
2. Actuall, which is the fruit of that corruption in evill thoughts, words and deeds, Pſal. 51.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the puniſhment due to ſin?

div.p: A. All curſes and plagues in this life, at the end death, and after that eternall torment in Hell, Deut. 28.16, 17. Rom. 9.23 2 Theſ. 1.8, 9.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Seeing we are all ſinners, by what means may we eſcape thoſe miſeries which we have deſerved, and recover happineſſe?

div.p: A. Onely by Jeſus Chriſt, Acts 41.2.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Jeſus Chriſt?

div.p: A. Jeſus Chriſt is the onely begotten Son of God, who alſo became man for our ſalvation, Luke 1.35. John 1.14.

p.label: Q
p.hi: What hath Chriſt done and ſuffered for our redemption?

list.item: He fulfilled the Law for us, Mat. 3.15.
2. He hath endured the curſe of the Law due to our ſinnes, Eſay 53.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How are men made partakers of the benefits of thoſe things which Chriſt did and ſuffered?

div.p: A. By Faith, John 1.12.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is Faith?

div.p: A. A grace whereby we receive Chriſt as our perfect Saviour, and reſt upon him alone for ſalvation, Joh. 1.12. Acts 16.31.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How is Faith wrought in us?

list.item: 1. Inwardly by the Spirit of God, Acts 16.14.
2. Outwardly, by the preaching of the Word, Rom. 10.14.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What meanes hath God appointed to strengthen our faith?

div.p: A. All his holy Ordinances, eſpecially his Sacraments, Act. 2.38.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is chiefly to be conſidered in a Sacrament?

list.item: 1. The outward ſignes and rites.
2. The inward things ſignified thereby

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How many Sacraments are there?

div.p: A. Two, Baptiſine and the Lords Supper, Mat. 28.19. Mat. 26.26. &c.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the ſpeciall uſe of Baptiſme?

div.p: To ingraft us into Chriſt, Mat. 28.19. Gal. 4.27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the outward ſign in Baptiſm?

div.p: A. Water, Act. 10 47.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth that ſet forth?

div.p: A. Chriſts Blood, Rev. 1.5.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth the ſprinkling of it upon the party baptized ſet out.

div.p: A. Our ſpirituall cleanſing from ſin by the blood of Chriſt, 1 Pet. 1.2.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is the ſpeciall uſe of the Lords Supper?

list.item: 1 To make us remember Chriſts death, 1 Cor. 11.25.
2 To make us grow in grace.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What are the outward ſignes thereof?

div.p: A. Bread and Wine, Mat. 26.26, 27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth the Bread ſet forth?

div.p: A. The Body of Chriſt, Mat. 26.26.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth the Wine ſet forth?

div.p: A. The Blood of Chriſt, Mat. 26.27.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In whoſe roome ſtands the Miniſter?

div.p: A. In the roome of God himſelfe, 2 Cor. 5.20.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is ſet forth by the Miniſters bleſſing Bread and Wine?

div.p: A. Gods ſetting of his Son apart for our Redemption, Ioh. 10.36.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is ſignified by breaking the bread?

div.p: A. The ſufferings which Chriſt endured in his body, 1 Cor. 11.24.

p.hi: What is ſignified by powring out of wine?

div.p: A. Shedding Chriſts blood, Luk. 22.20.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is ſignified by the Miniſters giving Bread and Wine to the Communicants?

div.p: A. Gods giving of his Son unto them, Mat. 26.26.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What doth peoples taking Bread and Wine ſet out?

div.p: A. Their applying Chriſts body and blood unto themſelves by faith, Ioh. 6.35.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is required of every one before he comes to the Lords Table?

div.p: A. He muſt examine himſelfe, 1 Cor. 11.28.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Of what muſt he examine himſelfe?

list.item: 1. Of his ſins.
2. Of his graces.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Of what graces muſt a man, before his coming to the Lords Table, examine himſelf?

list.item: 1. Of his Knowledge.
2. Of his Faith.
3. Of his Repentance.
4. Of his Love.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: How ought every one to behave himſelf at the Lords Table?

div.p: A. With all holy reverence, thankfully remembring Chriſts death, and ſeriouſly conſidering the things that are ſignified by the outward ſignes and rites, Eccleſ. 5.11. Cor. 11.25.
Q. What is the danger of unworthy receiving?
A. Unworthy receivers are guilty or the body and blood of Chriſt, and ſo doe eat and drink their own damnation, 1 Cor. 11.27.29.

p.label: Queſt.
p.hi: What is to be done after our receiving?

list.item: We muſt give hearty thankes unto God, as for all his benefits, ſo eſpecially for giving unto us Chriſt, to perfect the work of our ſalvation.
2. We muſt examine how we have profited by our receiving.
3. Wee muſt carefully performe our vowes and promiſes made unto God, of leading a new life, & bringing forth fruits meet for repentance.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is repentance?

div.p: A. It is a ſighing and ſorrowing for ſins, and turning from them to God, Acts 3.9.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Is this repentance neceſſary to ſalvation?

div.p: A. Yes, for except men repent, they ſhall ſurely periſh, Luk. 13.3.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: What is a godly life?

div.p:
A. A life conſcionably ordered according
to the Word of God, in holineſſe and righteouſneſſe, Pſal. 119.19. Luk. 1.75.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Is a godly life alſo neceſſary to ſalvation?

div.p: A. Yes, for without holineſs and righteouſneſs no man ſhall ſee the Lord, Heb. 12.14.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: Seeing the ſoule of man is immortall and cannot dye, what ſhall become there • f when it ſhall be ſeparated from the body?

div.p: A. The ſoules of the faithfull ſhall immediately live with Chriſt in bleſſedneſſe, and the ſouls of the wicked ſhall immediately go into hell torments, Luk. 16.22, 23. and Chap. 23. ver. 43. Phil. 1.23.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: But ſhall not the body alſo be quickned and raiſed againe?

div.p: A. Yes, there ſhall be a Reſurrection of the bodies both of the juſt and unjuſt at the laſt day, at which time the ſoule and body ſhall be united, and ſhall all appear before the Judgement Seat of Chriſt, to receive according to what they have done in their life times, whether good or evill; then ſhall the righteous inherite life eternall, but the wicked ſhall goe into everlaſting torment, John. 5.28, 29. Matth. 25.32. 2 Cor. 5.10. Matth. 25.46.
